definition: to rank/ranking/seniority (among siblings)
a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
the charts (of best-sellers)/table of ranking

sentences.english: But, she's never achieved chart success with her music.
sentences.chinese: 但是她的音乐从没有成功的进入过排行榜。

sentences.english: Yao also is near the top of another, more unfortunate leaderboard.
sentences.chinese: 在另一个更令人遗憾的排行榜上，姚明也跻身前列。

sentences.english: Near the top of the nutrient-dense food list are whole eggs.
sentences.chinese: 在营养素密集食品排行榜上鸡蛋名列前茅。

sentences.english: The more affordable applications typically dominate the top of the most-downloaded list.
sentences.chinese: 相对便宜的应用瓜分了下载量排行榜。

sentences.english: As all bankers know, league tables can mislead.
sentences.chinese: 所有的银行家都知道，排行榜有误导作用。

sentences.english: But some say the charts are slanted in favor of the stars who make the most small-screen appearances.
sentences.chinese: 而有人说排行榜十分青睐那些电视露面率很高的歌星。

sentences.english: Even the Loch Ness Monster makes the list at number 56.
sentences.chinese: 甚至连尼斯湖水怪也榜上有名，排行第56位。

sentences.english: Madonna has the number one song on the pop music charts.
sentences.chinese: 麦当那的歌曲在流行歌曲排行榜上位居第一。

sentences.english: In our family, my father generation had eleven brothers.
sentences.chinese: 我们家，我父亲一辈，大排行兄弟十一个。

sentences.english: So, on the weapon list, the Evil Scholar is the 1st runner-up.
sentences.chinese: 所以当今兵器谱上，书生夺命剑是排行第三。

sentences.english: The Spanish, in third place, are the coolest Europeans.
sentences.chinese: 排行第三的西班牙人是最酷的欧洲人。

sentences.english: Joyride topped the US chart in spring 1991.
sentences.chinese: 专辑《逍遥游》于1991年春荣登美国排行榜榜首。

sentences.english: She was the second of four daughters.
sentences.chinese: 她在四姐妹中排行第二。

sentences.english: Her debut album rose to the top of the charts immediately.
sentences.chinese: 她的首张专辑很快上升至各大排行榜首位置。

sentences.english: This record topped the charts for six weeks.
sentences.chinese: 这张唱片雄踞排行榜之冠长达六周之久。

sentences.english: California's unemployment rate, at 11 percent, is the fifth-highest in the nation.
sentences.chinese: 加州的失业率高达11%，排行全国第五。

definition: the charts (of best-sellers)/table of ranking
variant of 榜[bang3]
notice or announcement/list of names/public roll of successful examinees
to rank
ranking/ordered list/top 20/roll of honor/to come nth out of 100
to rank (1st, 2nd etc)/ranking
to be located at
to rank (number 1, or third last etc)/to be among (those who are in a particular group)
second only to.../(in second place) preceded only by...
third place
second place
to appear on the public roll of successful examinees (i.e. pass an exam)/to make the list/(of a song) to hit the charts
top three
to rank among the best
(of a list, music chart etc) to reach the top
leading/in first place/top of the list
to stand above/to occupy an important position/to rank (among the top few)
